question.text: The normal body colour of a grasshopper is green. The gene for this character is present on X chromosome. Due to recessive mutation in this gene, grasshoppers with pink body colour are produced. A male grasshopper with green body colour mates with a female grasshopper with pink body colour. Which of these statements is true?

options.text: All offsprings will be green irrespective of sex.
All offsprings will be pink irrespective of sex.
<math><mn>50</mn><mi>%</mi></math>  daughters will be green and  <math><mn>50</mn><mi>%</mi></math>  sons will be pink.
All the daughters will be green and all the sons will be pink.

solution.text: Grasshoppers show <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mn>O</mn></math> type of inheritance. Female grasshoppers have two <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> chromosomes and male grasshoppers have one X chromosome. Let the chromosome with the recessive mutation producing pink body colour is X<sup>p</sup>. Female grasshoppers with pink body colour will have X<sup>p</sup>X<sup>p</sup>. Male grass hopper will have one <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> . In the cross between X<sup>p</sup>X<sup>p </sup>and XO, only two phenotypes will be produced: XX<sup>p</sup> carrier females who will be green and X<sup>p</sup>O pink body males.
